title: Bengal man's body cut up, stuffed in bags; BLO admits murder, affair suspected
content: A primary school teacher, Rizwan Hasan Mondal, confessed to murdering Nasir Ali, a Baduria resident, after abducting him. Ali's dismembered body parts were recovered from three water bodies. Police suspect an alleged extramarital affair between Mondal and Ali's wife as the motive. Mondal's associate has also been arrested.

title: J&K crackdown: 8,000+ mule accounts frozen; anti-national activities suspected
content: Jammu and Kashmir security agencies have frozen over 8,000 mule accounts in three years, identifying them as crucial for global scam networks and potential funding of anti-national activities. These accounts facilitate the conversion of stolen money into untraceable cryptocurrency, with authorities urging banks and law enforcement to curb their rise and identify "mulers" who manage them.

title: 'Psychological edge already ours': Former Pakistan captain makes bold claim
content: Former Pakistan captain Mohammad Hafeez believes the intense focus on spinner Usman Tariq provides a psychological edge over India. Hafeez suggests the debate surrounding Tariq's bowling action is causing "panic" in the Indian camp, forcing them to specifically prepare for him. He urged Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha to use Tariq aggressively to maximize his game-changing potential.

title: Go all in on AI or leave: 4 key things from Google's voluntary exit memo to staff
content: Google has introduced a Voluntary Exit Program (VEP) for employees in specific business units, as detailed in a memo from chief business officer Philipp Schindler. This program offers severance packages to employees who may not be thriving at the company's pace or are ready for new opportunities.

title: 'Deep friendship': Birla, Misri to attend Tarique Rahman's oath-taking in Dhaka
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will represent India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's PM-elect Tarique Rahman, following the BNP's landslide victory. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri will accompany Birla. This event marks a significant diplomatic shift for Dhaka, especially after former PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster and subsequent exile in India. The new BNP government's stance will be closely observed.

title: 18,000 Indians, 12,000 Pakistanis, and 2,000 SL Police: Scale of India-Pakistan showdown
content: Tens of thousands of Indian and Pakistani fans have converged on Colombo for the high-voltage India-Pakistan clash, turning the city into a fortress with massive security deployment. Beyond politics and critique, the match has energised local livelihoods, packed the stadium to capacity and reaffirmed why this rivalry remains cricket’s most powerful spectacle.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Rijiju sets March 9 debate on no-confidence against Birla; Nehru’s 1954 message resurfaces
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the Lok Sabha will debate and vote on a no-confidence motion against the Speaker on March 9. This follows a submission by 118 Congress MPs alleging partisan conduct. Historically, such motions against Speakers are rare, with past instances including those against GV Mavalankar, Sardar Hukum Singh, and Balram Jakhar.

title: Soap opera over soap: Why Karnataka politics is in a ‘lather’ over iconic Mysuru brand
content: At the heart of the row is Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), the government-owned company that manufactures Mysuru Sandal Soap. Founded during the reign of Nalwadi Krishnaraja Wadiyar, the brand is not merely a commercial product. For many Kannadigas, it is an aromatic symbol of heritage. Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP K Sudhakar accused the Congress-led Karnataka government of displaying what he called an “anti-Kannada mindset”.

title: Babar-Rizwan masterclass to 'Kohli goes down the ground': How Ind & Pak have fared in 2020s
content: India and Pakistan's T20 World Cup encounters have been closely contested, despite India's 7-1 head-to-head record. Recent matches in the 2020s, including the 2021 loss, the thrilling 2022 victory, and the tight 2024 win, highlight decisive moments rather than one-sided dominance.

title: Nvidia gives 30,000 engineers OpenAI Codex access after CEO says 'stop coding'
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: 'Betraying farmers' vs 'spreading lies': Rahul Gandhi, Amit Shah clash over India–US deal
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Modi government of betraying farmers through the India-US trade deal, raising concerns about GM maize imports and potential pressure on Indian crops. Union Home Minister Amit Shah refuted these claims, calling them lies and asserting that farmers' interests are protected in trade agreements with the US, EU, and UK.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech’s girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens’ use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Lulu Retail to open 50 new stores across Middle East: Hundreds of jobs up for grabs
content: Lulu Retail is set to open 50 new stores across the GCC by 2028, bolstering its presence with hypermarkets and smaller formats. This ambitious expansion, following record revenues, promises hundreds of jobs and aims to enhance accessibility to essentials. The move signifies Lulu's commitment to both physical and digital retail growth, adapting to evolving consumer habits in the region.

title: Global cues, AI disruption fears to steer markets this week: Analysts
content: Stock markets are poised for a volatile week, driven by US economic data, the Federal Reserve's policy outlook, and growing AI disruption fears. Analysts anticipate a cautious sentiment as investors monitor global geopolitical events and currency movements. Domestic sectors like banking and automobiles may gain traction, while broader indices are expected to trade sideways awaiting clearer economic signals.

title: Dubai’s Ramadan 2026 plans revealed: 30 days of fireworks, drone shows, cultural events
content: Dubai is set to host a spectacular Ramadan 2026, commencing February 19th or 20th, with a vibrant calendar blending spiritual observance and city-wide festivities. Expect dazzling drone light shows and fireworks illuminating the night sky, alongside cultural installations and community gatherings. These events aim to unite residents and visitors in a celebration of light, art and shared experiences.

title: Travis Kelce retirement talk gets emotional as Donna Kelce shares views
content: Travis Kelce retirement speculation has intensified after a frustrating season and missed playoffs. Donna Kelce urged her son to follow his heart, while the Chiefs remain hopeful he returns. Kelce admitted he is still searching for answers, balancing his love for football with physical recovery and personal life changes. His decision will shape not just his future, but also the Chiefs’ path forward.

title: Doctor explains how neuroblastoma is often mistaken for weight gain due to swollen belly
content: A child's slightly enlarged belly can be an early, subtle sign of neuroblastoma, a rare cancer primarily affecting young children. This cancer often grows in the abdomen, and initial symptoms like a rounded tummy, vague stomach pain, or fatigue can be easily mistaken for common childhood issues. Early detection is crucial for better treatment outcomes.

title: India-US trade deal to help secure crude at competitive prices: Piyush Goyal
content: India and the US aim to boost bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030, with energy imports like crude oil and LNG forming a key part. This interim trade agreement will help India secure competitive energy prices and diversify suppliers. The pact also focuses on increasing steel, coking coal, and IT exports, enhancing market access for Indian goods.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: No need to question tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra anymore, says IO
content: Police investigating a Lamborghini crash in Kanpur stated no further interrogation of accused Shivam Kumar Mishra is needed, as all required questioning was completed at his arrest. Mishra, son of a local businessman, was granted bail hours after his arrest, with the court directing his cooperation in the ongoing investigation.

title: Speeding Thar crashes into police patrol vehicle near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's residence
content: A major tragedy was averted in Patna's VVIP area when an over-speeding SUV collided with a police patrol vehicle near the chief minister's residence. The forceful impact damaged both vehicles, with the SUV smashing through a guardrail. While a female police officer sustained injuries, others were safe, and four individuals were detained for questioning.

title: FPIs infuse Rs 19,675 crore in early February after months of heavy selling
content: Foreign investors injected Rs 19,675 crore into Indian stocks in early February, reversing months of outflows. This surge, driven by a US-India trade deal and easing global economic worries, signals renewed optimism. Despite this, overall 2025 flows remain weak, with significant net outflows recorded year-to-date.

title: Rajkummar Rao’s new look sparks concern as viral video leave fans surprised
content: Rajkummar Rao's recent appearance at a film festival has sparked online buzz due to a noticeable change in his hair and facial features. Sporting a patchy beard and thinner hair, fans expressed shock and concern, with some struggling to recognize the actor. Speculation suggests this transformation might be preparation for his role in the upcoming Sourav Ganguly biopic.

title: 'White-collar' terror probe: Doctors formed 'Ansar Interim' to carry out attacks
content: A new terror outfit, 'Ansar Interim,' formed by radicalised doctors, has been exposed by J&K Police. The group, allegedly linked to Al-Qaeda, planned subversive activities, including IED attacks. Investigations revealed procurement of explosive materials and attempts to recruit members, with a key operative planning a VBIED blast.

title: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar urges devotees to embrace meditation on Mahashivratri
content: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar urged deep inner reflection and devotion this Mahashivratri, emphasizing meditation and chanting to elevate spiritual practice. Prime Minister Modi and defence minister Rajnath Singh extended greetings, praying for well-being and prosperity. The festival celebrates the divine union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, observed with reverence across India.

title: 'It's 'wrong'—Harbhajan blasts Amir for his Abhishek Sharma remarks
content: Harbhajan Singh defended Abhishek Sharma after Mohammad Amir called him a “slogger” ahead of the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup clash. Harbhajan said Abhishek is a skilled and determined batsman with a full range of shots, not someone who blindly hits the ball. He criticised critics for judging without facing him and urged Abhishek to prove himself with a big innings for India.

title: 'If the opposition doesn't allow the House to function, we will go for the guillotine': Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will be debated and voted on March 9. The second part of the Budget session, starting the same day, is expected to be "interesting" with crucial legislation. Rijiju warned that continued opposition protests could be detrimental to them and suggested potential cracks in opposition unity.

title: 15-year relationship, one WhatsApp text: What led to Noida’s Valentine’s Day car murder
content: A man and woman were found dead with gunshot wounds in a locked car in Noida, with police initially suggesting suicide due to a pistol found in the man's hand. However, the man's family alleges murder due to caste-related threats, while the woman's family claims past harassment and recent marital arrangements due to caste differences.

title: Pakistan-linked ‘death squads’ accused as seven go missing in Balochistan
content: Recent disappearances in Balochistan, including at least seven individuals in Panjgur and Karachi, are linked to Pakistan's security apparatus. Residents reported raids and detentions, with families of those taken, like Zulfiqar and Zakir Noor, receiving no information, raising fears of secret confinement.

title: Kedarnath shrine to reopen on April 22; dates for other 3 Dhams also announced - check
content: Kedarnath Temple will welcome devotees from April 22, concluding its winter hiatus. The auspicious reopening date was fixed on Mahashivratri at the shrine's winter seat. This marks the commencement of the Char Dham Yatra, with Badrinath opening on April 23, and Gangotri and Yamunotri on April 19. Thousands are expected to participate in the pilgrimage.

title: Raising children in India vs US: American woman shares 6 differences she experienced
content: An American mother raising her daughters in India shares relatable social media comparisons of parenting styles.  Her viral reel highlights differences in sleeping arrangements, baby carrying, feeding, bedtime routines, discipline, and even milk preparation.  These everyday contrasts reveal how cultural values shape childhood, emphasizing that each approach expresses care in its own unique way.

title: Indian-origin student found dead in US: Friend says he 'stopped caring about life'
content: A 22-year-old Indian postgraduate student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, from the University of California, Berkeley, has been found dead. His body was recovered from Lake Anza by authorities after a days-long search. The Indian Consulate in San Francisco confirmed the recovery and is providing support to his family.

title: Saudi Premium Residency for exceptional talent: Salary requirements and eligibility explained
content: Saudi Arabia's Exceptional Talent Premium Residency now welcomes more entities, but strict salary requirements remain. Researchers need SR14,000 monthly, while scientific/healthcare pros require SR35,000. Top executives must earn SR80,000. This selective program targets experienced professionals and leaders, offering five-year renewable residency with family benefits and property ownership.

title: Political stability, political predictability restored investor confidence in India, says PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi said that “Budget not a ‘now or never’ moment born out of compulsion but a ‘we are ready’ moment born out of preparation, inspiration”

title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari flags border security concerns in Bengal after Bangladesh polls
content: The BJP leader in his post in Bengali alleged that the ruling Trinamool Congress government in the State has repeatedly failed to extend full cooperation in land acquisition needed by the BSF for border fencing

title: NLCIL signs MoU with NALCO for thermal and renewable energy collaboration
content: The collaboration also enables exploration of long-term power tie-ups, including captive and group captive arrangements

title: PM Modi to inaugurate India AI Impact Expo on February 16
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s senior aide Maxim Oreshkin will lead a large delegation for the AI Impact Summit, which will be held alongside the Expo in New Delhi

title: Award-winning farmer dies in Kannur; suicide suspected
content: Elias Ambatt, who won the Chief Minister’s award for best vegetable farmer, was facing  severe financial distress following poor harvests in recent seasons, say family members

title: Tamil Nadu SIR: Final electoral rolls to be published on February 23
content: ECI said lists of logical discrepancies were put up and objections were invited as mandated by the Supreme Court of India and the concerned persons were permitted to submit their documents/objections

title: Five hurt, 40 two-wheelers destroyed in fire in basement of Dombivli building
content: “The blaze broke out in the basement parking of a residential building in the Sagaon area of Dombivli town around 4 a.m.,” Says an official

title: Devotees throng Akhanda Godavari to take a holy dip on Sivaratri in Godavari region
content: Trial run of all the initiatives meant for Godavari Pushkarams-2027 has been conducted along the Ghats of the Godavari river

title: Social media influencer Chinnu Pappu’s death:  man questioned found dead in Kasaragod
content: Social media influencer Reshma, popularly known as Chinnu Pappu, was earlier found dead in Kasaragod. Officials say they are examining whether there are any links between the two deaths

title: Chess to be introduced in Tribal schools to improve learning outcomes
content: In some schools, teachers have voluntarily introduced the game to improve academic engagement of students before the ini

title: MP urges Union Labour Minister to expedite swift take over of ESI Hospital in Mangaluru by ESIC
content: The MP said that as required, Karnataka government has constituted Karnataka ESI Society to enable the ESIC to take over the ESI Hospital in Mangaluru

title: Byrathi Basavaraj remanded into seven days CID custody in Bikla Shiva murder case
content: Basavaraj was arrested by CID officials at the Bengaluru airport arrival terminal soon after he landed from Ahmedabad, following the rejection of his bail plea by the Supreme Court on February 12, 2026

title: India adds more than 50,000 MW of power generation capacity in current financial year
content: With the addition, India as on January 31, commands 5,20,510.95 MW of total power generation capacity

title: Eight provisions of VB-G RAM G Act challenged before Madras High Court
content: In his affidavit, the litigant stated the MGNREGA had been one of the world’s largest social security initiatives which had been studied and evaluated intensively by multiple organisations

title: Witnessing betrayal of Indian farmers in name of U.S. trade deal: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, in a post on X, asked the Centre what it meant by “additional products” and whether this signalled pressure to gradually open up pulses and other crops to U.S. imports.

title: Government doing a ‘very thorough study’ of non-scheduled flight operators, uncontrolled airfields: Rammohan Naidu
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has already initiated a special safety audit of NSOPs earlier this month

title: Meghalaya MP seeks freeze on environmental clearance process for new cement plant
content: Mr. Syngkon said East Jaintia Hills already has several cement and extractive industries and cautioned that evaluating projects in isolation without assessing cumulative regional impacts could undermine environmental safeguards.

title: Free helicopter ride for 10 students and five progressive farmers at Budanur fest, says Mandya MLA
content: The Budanur festival is an annual religious and cultural celebration centered around the 12-13th century Hoysala-era Ananthapadmanabha temple and Kashi Vishwanatha Temple, which draw large crowds to Budanur situated close to Mandya town

title: Amit Shah accuses Rahul of misinformation on U.S., EU trade deals; says farmers’ interests safeguarded
content: I feel like laughing when Congress's Shahzada Rahul Gandhi stands in Parliament and talks about protecting farmers, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Former Congress leader Nasimuddin Siddiqui joins Samajwadi Party
content: The fresh round of inductions is seen as a strategic move by the SP to strengthen its social base for the upcoming 2027 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections

title: ‘Rathotsavam’ draws crowds to Srinivasa Mangapuram
content: Members of various cultural organisations and Bhajan troupes performed ‘Kolatam’ and ‘Chekka Bhajan’ ahead of the chariot, which pepped up the festive mood

title: Retired High Court judge to head judicial probe into blast at Meghalaya's coal mine
content: The panel has been tasked with fixing accountability and examining possible constitutional exemptions to central mining laws, said the notification dated February 14.

title: Security agencies bust massive 'mule account' network in J&K; fear misuse by terror groups
content: The officials said more than 8,000 mule accounts operating in the region have been identified and frozen over a period of three years, exposing a sophisticated network of money laundering

title: Missing married woman found safe in Kunigal, Hassan police confirm
content: The 29-year-old woman, who sparked fears of foul play after disappearing following a wedding, was located unharmed with a friend

title: VHP president Yarlagadda Lakshmi Prasad seeks allocation of an additional ₹50 crore to Andhra University in A.P. Budget
content: As Andhra University celebrates its centenary, VHP president emphasises the need for enhanced funding to support academic growth and development

title: Maharashtra ATS conducts raids in two districts over suspected terror activities
content: The ATS combed more than 20 locations in the two districts in the raids launched around midnight and has rounded up over a dozen suspects, they said.

title: Pawan Kalyan launches Jana Sena membership drive
content: Mr. Kalyan said the JSP had started with just 150 people and enrolled 90,000 members during the first membership drive conducted in 2021.

title: Woman from Uttar Pradesh murdered over dowry in Jharkhand
content: In his complaint, the father alleged that his daughter was frequently beaten and harassed over dowry since the wedding.

title: U.P. cough syrup smuggling case: SP youth wing's former state secretary arrested
content: The U.P. Police is probing an alleged illegal network involved in the storage and distribution of highly regulated codeine-laced cough syrups across the State

title: Assam government has written to Centre for more emergency landing facilities: Himanta
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that the state government will ink a pact with the Civil Aviation Ministry to carry out a study to construct four more airports at Majuli, Diphu, Umrangso and Manas

title: Caste row over Dalit woman’s engagement at anganwadi centre in Odisha resolved, says official
content: The anganwadi centre will function normally from February 16, as the parents consented to send their children, Sujata Nayak, member of State commission for protection of child rights, saidKendrapara

title: Two involved in shooting at migrant labourers in Punjab's Moga held after encounter
content: Two migrant labourers were injured after three unidentified assailants on a motorcycle allegedly opened fire at a group of workers in the district on February 10

title: Bangladesh seeks reset in India ties, onus on New Delhi to recognise changed reality: Tarique's Advisor
content: Bangladesh has invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi and several other regional leaders to attend the swearing-in ceremony of the country's next Prime Minister, Tarique Rahman

title: Mysuru police arrest three, seize more than 40 grams of MDMA
content: It was found that one of them procured MDMA from an unknown person in Bengaluru through social media and later sold it in Mysuru

title: Five killed several others injured as car jumps divider, crashes into a KSRTC bus
content: Due to the impact of the collision, the front portion of the bus was damaged and left a few passengers seated in the front rows with minor injuries

title: Rijiju warns Opposition against disruption, says govt. will table ‘critical’ Bill in second half of Budget Session
content: Kiren Rijiju says the Lok Sabha will debate on the no-confidence motion moved against the Speaker on March 9; he says the government will “go for the guillotine” if the Opposition does not let the House to function

title: AI adoption leading to moderation in entry-level hiring: Report
content: Gen AI is primarily functioning as a productivity-enhancing complement to technical and analytical work, rather than a substitute, the report said

title: Sasikala to continue her consultations with her followers on finalising strategy for 2026 T.N. Assembly poll
content: The purpose of Ms. Sasikala’s ongoing discussion is to finalise her camp’s strategy for the 2026 Assembly election; she has planned to hold discussion up to February 18, says her follower who is a former legislator.

title: Man arrested for posting video with 'objectionable remarks' against PM Modi in Uttar Pradesh
content: Charthawal police station SHO Satyanarayan Dahiya told reporters that the accused has been identified as Jitendra Kumar Kashyap

title: Nirmala Sitharaman holds key bilateral meetings in Munich, highlights investment opportunities
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman underlined the financial role the ECB can play in facilitating trade under the EU-India FTA deal

title: Delhi's minimum temperature at 11.1°C, AQI remains 'poor'
content: Air quality in the city was recorded in the 'poor' category at 9 a.m., with an Air Quality Index (AQI) reading of 210, Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data showed.

title: Munich Security Conference: Jaishankar meets Ukrainian counterpart Andrii Sybiha
content: We also covered cooperation within international organisations and reaffirmed our mutual interest in further contacts, expanding trade, and deepening bilateral ties, says  Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha in a post on X

title: In frames | Hook, line, and ice
content: In Kashmir, lakes and rivers sustain a vibrant fishing culture that blends livelihood, tradition, and cuisine; seasonal rhythms and deep-rooted culinary heritage is preserved by the local community

title: Bengal: Coach of empty passenger train catches fire, none injured
content: Passengers at the station noticed flames engulfing the coach, triggering a brief commotion on the platform

title: Vice-President, PM Modi extend Mahashivratri greetings
content: Vice-President Radhakrishnan and PM Modi wish the nation prosperity and blessings on Mahashivratri, celebrating India’s spiritual tradition

title: Three militants, including two women, arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested two women cadres of the banned outfit People's Liberation Army (PLA) from the vicinity of Sunrise Ground in Tengnoupal district

title: India ‘very successful’ emerging economy; right place to host AI summit: UN Chief Guterres
content: Mr. Guterres asserted “it would be totally unacceptable that AI would be just a privilege of the most developed countries or a division only between two superpowers”, an apparent reference to the U.S. and China

title: Raoul Hyman, Alister Yoong Triumph as The Indian Racing Festival Goa debut delivers thrills
content: The 2.064-km circuit showcased thrilling competition and impressive stunts, while Speed Demons Delhi set a high standard for future races

title: Tarique Rahman’s swearing-in: PM Modi receives invite, LS Speaker Om Birla to attend
content: PM Modi declines the invitation, as he will be in Mumbai for bilateral talks with French President Emmanuel Macron, and then will chair the AI impact summit in Delhi

title: Ensure zero human death in elephant attacks: Jharkhand CM asks officials
content: Man-elephant conflicts in Jharkhand have left as many as 474 people dead since the 2019-20 fiscal, according to a government report

title: Owaisi demands action against YouTubers targeting vendor at Medaram Jatara
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi demanded the Telangana Police book cases against those who harassed the vendor

title: Bengaluru student Saketh Srinivasaiah found dead in the U.S.
content: Saketh Sreenivasaiah, a student at the University of California, Berkeley, hailing from Karnataka, had been missing since Monday (February 9, 2026)

title: Probe into Ahmedabad air crash still underway: Mohol
content: On Thursday (February 12, 2026), the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) said the probe was still in progress and no final conclusions have been reached

title: Meta to cut pay outs to fact-checking partners in India
content: Two people with knowledge of discussions with the social media company told The Hindu that the firm planned to cut payments to professional fact checkers it has paid since 2016 by a third to half

title: Chennai RWA shines in TN’s solar race
content: Bollineni Hillside, a 1295-unit gated community in Perumbakkam off Old Mahabalipuram Road, has bagged an award for the biggest solar rooftop installation in Tamil Nadu in the category for resident welfare associations

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin inspects ongoing work on sports complex in Tirupattur
content: The new complex will have a spectator’s gallery with a seating capacity of over 3,500 to watch football games and athletic events

title: Love and its newfangled terms
content: Married couples in India are, reportedly, increasingly opening themselves up to alternative relationship models and structures, often in pursuit of authentic happiness and trust. Perceived for long as conservative, it seems Tamil Nadu is not entirely so. Some of the cities are now accommodating ethical non-monogamy — very simply, a relationship involving many and with consent. Preeti M.S. syncs up with married couples in Tamil Nadu to explore these new trends

title: Ahead of State budget, resident welfare associations demand focus on civic infrastructure
content: The Alliance of Resident Welfare Associations has called on the GCC to allocate funds in the interim Budget for a technical audit and rectification of stormwater drains, restoration of roads, and completion of pending infrastructure works

title: Found in translation
content: As Parliament adds interpreters in over 20 Indian languages, the small group of people who translate speeches and other proceedings simultaneously as business unfolds in the two houses tell Aroon Deep about the emerging field

title: West Bengal BJP leadership reaches out to Muslims, says Trinamool has done nothing for minorities
content: The remarks by WB BJP president Samik Bhattacharya, which come ahead of the Assembly polls in the State, marks a significant departure from the earlier stand of the saffron party where it did not engage with minorities.

title: What’s in store for garment exporters to the U.S.? | Explained
content: What has the U.S. promised Bangladesh with respect to textiles? What are the conditions laid down by the U.S. to give Bangladeshi exporters unprecedented access to American markets? What is the assurance that Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal gave Indian textile exporters?

title: How is U.S.-India trade deal being tweaked? | Explained
content: What are the areas that have come under scrutiny? Has India stopped buying Russian oil as Donald Trump has claimed? What is happening in the agricultural sector? Has the reference to pulses been removed from the draft? When is the formal agreement expected to be signed?

title: Ritu Tawde | Mayor rising
content: The new BMC chief has to navigate a strong and experienced opposition and a small but assertive ally while steering the city’s administration

title: Piyush Goyal | Crisis manager
content: The Commerce Minister finds himself on the frontline when the government is busy defending the U.S. trade deal which critics say is one-sided

title: Union, W.B. Education Ministers spar over NEP, funds
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan cites various statistics to argue that the education system in West Bengal had deteriorated during the Trinamool Congress regime. West Bengal Education Minister Bratya Basu refuted all the allegations

title: State level wrestling tournament begins in Bihar
content: Commonwealth Games gold medallist shooter and sports minister Shreyasi Singh asserted that the dream and goal is to ensure the participation of as many players from Bihar as possible in the Olympics in the future.

title: After couple found dead in Noida, man's family alleges murder, caste-based threats by woman's kin
content: The couple allegedly received taunts from the woman's family, and the man's family had received threats, including calls from international numbers warning of police action

title: 3,058 voters to be removed from final voter rolls in Ernakulam as SIR hearing comes to a close
content: Exclusions include deceased voters, those who have permanently shifted from the district, and persons who have relinquished Indian citizenship

title: We thwarted BJP’s attempt to halt Magalir Urimai Thogai, says Stalin
content: He criticises the BJP-led Centre for not introducing any new schemes or projects for Tamil Nadu and came down heavily on AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami for giving away the State’s rights to the Centre

title: Kerala SIR: Hearings phase concludes
content: Final roll will be published on February 21 as per the schedule published by the Election Commission of India

title: ISRO could relaunch PSLV by June or July: Jitendra Singh
content: Gaganyaan, ISRO’s first crewed space mission, was slated for 2027 and would proceed as scheduled, he says

title: ‘I had seconds to react’: Survivor recounts horror of STRR crash that killed seven
content: A team from the National Highways Authority of India, which is in charge of the Satellite Town Ring Road, inspected the accident spot on Saturday

title: Supreme Court to hear Sabarimala review pleas on February 16
content: In November 2019, a majority judgment by a five-judge Constitution Bench led by the then Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi had referred the Sabarimala review and writ petitions to a seven-judge Bench

title: Three MEMU trains in Kerala to add coaches from Feb. 23: Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: The number of coaches on the trains—Palakkad–Ernakulam–Palakkad, Kollam–Ernakulam–Kollam, and Kollam–Kottayam–Kollam—has been increased from eight to twelve, Mr. Gopi said.

title: Missing Bengaluru student in US: CS seeks MEA intervention
content: On Saturday, the Consulate General of India in San Francisco confirmed that it is actively coordinating with local authorities in the United States in connection with the disappearance Saketh

title: Police put up posters seeking information on JeM ‘commander’ in Kishtwar amid reports of escape attempt
content: ‘Unnecessary movement’ has been barred within five kilometres from the International Border in Kathua district owing to ‘sensitive situation’ and possibility of cross-border firing

title: TTU rides Toppin gem to upset of No. 1 Arizona
content: Texas Tech's JT Toppin finished Saturday's upset overtime win vs. No. 1 Arizona with 31 points, 13 rebounds, three assists, two steals and a block.

title: Silver considering all fixes for NBA's tanking issue
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver called tanking the worst it has been in "recent memory" and said he is not ruling out any potential remedy, including taking away draft picks, to stop it.

title: Dame claims 3rd title; Johnson wins dunk contest
content: Damian Lillard, nine months after undergoing surgery on his torn Achilles, won his third All-Star 3-point contest to tie with Larry Bird and Craig Hodges for the most ever.

title: A. Kim scores first win since 2010 in LIV stunner
content: Anthony Kim, who needed to play a qualifying tournament last month just to get another season on the LIV Tour, capped a remarkable career comeback by winning LIV Golf Adelaide on Sunday.

title: Klaebo sets Olympic record, wins 9th XXC gold
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo has won a ninth gold medal in cross-country skiing, setting a Winter Games record, at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Sources: MAC to add Sac State for football in '26
content: The MAC presidents have voted to formally add FCS Sacramento State into the league as a football-only member starting in 2026, sources told ESPN.

title: Eichel, Tkachuk rally unbeaten U.S. past Denmark
content: The U.S. men's Olympic hockey team rode its top line to a 6-3 win over Denmark and remain tied with also-unbeaten Canada going into the final day of the preliminary round.

title: Sources: Raiders promote Crosby coach Leonard
content: The Raiders are promoting run game coordinator/defensive line coach Rob Leonard to defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 🏈 One key offseason question for every NFL team
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: Slam dunks, global games, emerging stars: The biggest takeaways from All-Star Weekend
content: Our experts break down what to watch over the 2026 NBA All-Star Weekend and their picks for contests, competitions and more.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Mikaela Shiffrin skis, USA men's hockey back in action and more from Milan Cortina
content: Sunday at the Winter Olympics includes Mikaela Shiffrin skiing in giant slalom, Erin Jackson defending her 500m speedskating gold and USA men's hockey taking on Germany.

content: Impress your friends by repeating ESPN's easy-to-learn fun facts about the Great American Race ahead of this year's edition of the Daytona 500.

content: Mohamed Salah turning in a memorable performance in front of an adoring Anfield crowd? No, it's not 2024, but it sure felt like it on Saturday night in Liverpool.

content: Jumping over cars -- and Shaq -- wins fans but doesn't translate into the talents recruiters want to see

content: The selection committee's first reveal of the season leaned into head-to-head, but the metric isn't the only answer.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United wants Juventus defender Kalulu
content: Man United are looking to Serie A for a defender, while Chicago Fire are willing to go "all in" to sign Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Punjab BJP Leader Arvind Khanna Joins Shiromani Akali Dal
content: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Arvind Khanna on Sunday joined the Shiromani Akali Dal in the presence of party chief Sukhbir Singh Badal in Sangrur.

title: "There's This Sort Of Clown Show": Obama After Trump's Racist Monkey Clip
content: Former US president Barack Obama criticised a lack of shame and decorum in the country's political discourse, responding Saturday for the first time to a post on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted him and Michelle as monkeys.

title: Om Birla To Represent India At Tarique Rahman's Oath Ceremony In Bangladesh
content: The Speaker's participation at this important event underscores the deep and enduring friendship between the peoples of India and Bangladesh, the foreign ministry said.

title: Ukraine Ex-Minister Arrested While Fleeing Country Amid Corruption Scandal
content: Ukraine's NABU anti-corruption force said Sunday it arrested the country's former energy minister, German Galushchenko -- who resigned last year during a massive corruption scandal -- as he tried to cross Ukraine's border.

title: Papers From 1995 Shine Light On Nagaland Village Where Violence Broke Out
content: A village in Nagaland's Chumoukedima district where members of an Angami organisation and district officials including a policeman allegedly came under attack on Friday, had got permission from a Chakhro Angami village to settle down in the area.

title: Imran Khan Being Moved From Jail? His Party Says 'Ex-PM's Life At Risk'
content: Adding fuel to the already contentious issue of Imran Khan's health, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) claimed that its founder and former Prime Minister of Pakistan is being secretly moved from jail to a hospital for medical treatment.

title: India Has Potential To Lead In AI: Sam Altman Ahead Of AI Impact Summit
content: In a major endorsement of India's growing role in artificial intelligence, Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has described India as a potential "full-stack AI leader" and announced plans to expand the company's presence and partnerships in the country.

title: Why India's C-130J Is King Of Tactical Airlift Missions: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed on the northeast's first emergency landing field (ELF) in an Indian Air Force C-130J Super Hercules turboprop aircraft. This rugged transport plane is ideal for operating in difficult terrain, common in India.

title: 2,000-Year-Old Iron Age Temple Discovered In Denmark
content: A temple and fortified settlement were found in Denmark's Central region during a research being conducted by Museum Midtjylland.

title: 40,000-Year-Old Sealed Cave Opened In Gibraltar. Here's What Was Found
content: The Vanguard Cave in the Gorham's Cave Complex has been an area of interest among Gibraltar National Museum archaeologists since 2012.

title: What Aviation Body's Revised Breath Analyser Rules Mean For Pilots, Cabin Crew
content: India's aviation regulator has revised its norms on alcohol testing for pilots and cabin crew under the Civil Aviation Requirement (CAR). The revised rules moderate the regulatory baseline.

title: Thar Breaks Through Barricade, Rams Police Vehicle Near Nitish Kumar's Home
content: A major accident took place in Patna's VVIP area on Sunday, close to the Chief Minister's residence. The incident happened when a speeding Thar reportedly crashed into a patrol vehicle belonging to the Patna police's Shakti Suraksha team.

title: Iran Says "Ready To Discuss" Nuclear Programme Issues With US, Then A Rider
content: Iran is ready to discuss issues related to its nuclear programme, but then the sanctions against it will also have to be on the table, an Iranian minister said, adding that "the ball is in America's court".

title: Amid Probe Into Ajit Pawar's Death, New Video Of Crash Site Emerges
content: A video has surfaced on social media, with claims that it was from the crash site of a small plane in Maharashtra's Baramati where Ajit Pawar and four others died on January 28.

title: AI-Enabled Security To Keep An Eye On India's Mega AI Summit
content: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 to be held in Delhi from Monday to Friday will be packed with activities, for which the planners have made elaborate arrangements for efficiency and maximum security.

title: Award-Winning Kerala Farmer Dies By Suicide Over Debt
content: A 62-year-old award-winning farmer allegedly died by suicide due to mounting financial debt at Cherupuzha in this district.

title: Noida Couple's Death Mystery: Bodies With Gunshots In Car, A WhatsApp Note
content: A young man allegedly shot his girlfriend dead and then shot himself inside a car in Noida on Valentine's Day. Police found both bodies with gunshot wounds, along with a pistol and cartridges recovered from the vehicle.

title: Google Marks Annular Solar Eclipse With Animation: Here's How It Works
content: The world will witness its first solar eclipse of 2026 on Tuesday, February 17. The astronomical event, which is also known as the Ring Of Fire',has generated significant buzz among astronomers and stargazers.

title: India To Build Its 1st Underwater Road-Rail Tunnel At Rs 18,000 Crore
content: India has approved a Rs 18,662-crore project to build a four-lane access-controlled greenfield corridor between Gohpur and Numaligarh, featuring India's first road-and-rail tunnel under the Brahmaputra river in Assam.

title: "Trump Is Temporary, Will Be Gone In 3 Years": California Governor
content: The second-term governor and likely 2028 presidential candidate has taken his Donald Trump-bashing tour to the Munich Security Conference, weeks after he was in Davos, Switzerland, at the World Economic Forum.

title: USA defeats Denmark 6-3: Top moments from Olympic men's hockey
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) After a commanding  5-1 win  over Latvia, the United States men's hockey team was back in action for Game 2 of the preliminary round in the 2026 Olympics. Saturday's game was against Denmark, which lost 3-1 to Germany in its first game. The United States won, 6-3. The U.S. now sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Center  Brock Nelson  led the U.S. in scoring after one game, with two goals, while forwards  Jack Eichel ,  Jack Hughes ,  Matthew Tkachuk  and defenseman  Quinn Hughes  all had two assists. Forwards  Auston Matthews ,  Tage Thompson  and  Brady Tkachuk  were the other goal scorers in the opening contest. More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings

title: Two games, two wins: Grades, big questions after Team USA's dramatic win over Denmark
content: the game was much more dramatic than many had predicted, but the result was a 6-3 win for the united states over Denmark . team USA trailed 2-1 after the first period, before roaring back to score three in the second . the netminder allowed three goals on just 12 shots, one being a center-ice strike by rugged Danish league defender Nick Jensen .
